breadcrumbExamples.description: This page demonstrates different ways to use dynamic breadcrumbs.

dynamicFromData.description: Breadcrumb changes based on user selection.

resetToDefault.description: Reset breadcrumb back to route meta definition.

staticOverride.description: Breadcrumb is set statically when the component mounts.
staticOverride.title: Static Override

breadcrumbExamples.title: Dynamic Breadcrumb Examples

customConfirm.description: Confirmation with custom text and icons
customConfirm.title: Custom Confirm

alert.text: Your changes have been saved successfully.
alert.title: Important Notice

basicConfirm.text: Are you sure you want to proceed with this action?

customConfirm.text: This action will save your changes. Do you want to continue?
customConfirm.title: Custom Confirmation

destructiveConfirm.text: This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to delete this item?
destructiveConfirm.title: Delete Item

info.text: This is some useful information for the user.

asyncError.description: Triggers an error inside onMounted. The ErrorBoundary catches lifecycle errors the same way.
asyncError.title: Lifecycle Hook Error

errorBoundaryDemo.description: Demonstrates the ErrorBoundary component that catches rendering errors in child components and displays a fallback UI.

howItWorks.description: The ErrorBoundary component uses Vue's onErrorCaptured hook to catch errors from child components.

points.captures: Captures errors thrown during rendering or lifecycle hooks of child components
points.fallback: Displays a fallback UI with the error message instead of crashing the page
points.goHome: Includes a "Go Home" button for navigation away from the broken page
points.reset: Provides a "Try Again" button to reset the error state and re-render

howItWorks.title: How It Works

syncError.description: Triggers an error during the component's render function. The ErrorBoundary catches it and shows the fallback UI.
syncError.title: Synchronous Render Error

errorBoundaryDemo.title: Error Boundary Demo

usage.description: Wrap any component with ErrorBoundary to protect against unexpected errors.
usage.title: Usage

errorHandlingDemo.description: Demonstrates the unified error handling system with RFC 7807 Problem Details format

documentation.description: Learn more about the error handling system
documentation.title: Documentation

mockErrors.description: Test the error handling with simulated API responses

forbidden.description: Simulates access denial due to insufficient permissions
forbidden.title: Forbidden Error

notFound.description: Simulates a 404 error when a resource is not found (e.g., project with invalid ID)
notFound.title: Not Found Error

unauthorized.description: Simulates authentication failure with invalid or expired credentials
unauthorized.title: Unauthorized Error

validation.description: Simulates validation failure with multiple field-level errors
validation.title: Validation Error

mockErrors.title: Mock Error Examples

overview.description: This demo shows how the application handles various API errors using the unified error handling system. All errors follow the RFC 7807 Problem Details standard.

functions.messageDescription: Extracts just the error message string
functions.normalizeDescription: Converts any error to a normalized format with all details
functions.toastDescription: Normalizes and displays as toast notification

keyFeatures.consistentFormat: Consistent error format across all API endpoints
keyFeatures.toastNotifications: Automatic toast notifications for user feedback
keyFeatures.validationDetails: Structured validation errors with field-level details

overview.title: Overview

realApiErrors.description: Trigger actual API errors against the backend

notFound.description: Attempts to fetch a project with a valid but non-existent ID
notFound.title: 404 - Non-existent Project

realApiErrors.title: Real API Errors

validation.description: Attempts to create a project with invalid data
validation.title: 422 - Invalid Project Data

benefits.cleanApp: Clean App.vue: No layout logic in the main component
